headline.main: At Tax Time, Health Care Costs May Be a Factor

docs.abstract: Tax deductions for health and dental costs are becoming more popular as Americans spend more out of pocket for health care (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: When James Busby, a Brooklyn music teacher, was battling Kaposi's sarcoma, an AIDS-related cancer, his doctor prescribed some blood-building drugs to help him deal with the side effects of chemotherapy. The drugs allowed Mr. Busby to regain much of his strength. But, he said, they cost about half of his annual income. Mr. Busby eventually got some of his medical costs back -- from the Internal Revenue Service.
